intro: Anchusa rosea, commonly known as the rose campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of pink or purple flowers with five petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly woolly texture, while its root system is fibrous and adapted to well-drained soils. Anchusa rosea is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
